subject: Re: [junit] Stopping output of log4j statements to Console
msgSnippet: ... If your tests don t actually require logging output, then turn it off. That will give you a bigger performance boost. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar
messageBody:
Frank wrote:

> Is there a way (via the Ant task property settings) to stop putting
> all the log4j output to the console in addition to the log files
> where I am logging it?
>
> Our unit test suite takes many hours to complete and I believe it
> would be faster if it just logged it to the files,

If your tests don't actually require logging output, then turn it off.
That will give you a bigger performance boost.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
